reviews.review_msg: I had the best of time in her class; she is caring for her students, and loves what she teaches. I do think she gives out A LOT of readings, but most often from larger books she only picks out chapters and not the whole book. She's flexible with due dates as long as it's reasonable, so I guess it's a fair compromise.
loved reading DQ and other books, I mean Quixote... great course and excellent instructor.
he is an okay prof. he marks way too hard. he is pretty arrogant. i found his course too dificult. i am a good student.
great prof, too bad he got promoted and is gone!
fabulous, take anything from this guy. A pretty fair marker. Showing up to class and doing the readings does seem to be a pre-req to doing well, though.

my first thought was, a 900 page novel? you gotta be kidding. I'm in 4th year and noone ever asked me to read a book this long. But I loved Don Quixote & other books-- prof rides you hard so you expect a tough marker but he's actually a softie when you get your marks back
Worst teacher ever. Made us read way too much for a lower level course, and borrows money from students and never pays back!

Made us read 900 page novel (Don Quixotes) & I loved it. Handed out Cs like they were going out of style, but very fair. Excellent rapport with students. Those who did the readings love him -- not a prof to take if you're looking for the easy pass
I am hating this class and especially the professor horta. He is parvenue, rude, and expects too much. I won't even get into a the ego of his. Do not take him course

this guy's the greatest! had my serious doubts at first, especially concerning the course material, but they quickly faded away.  too lazy to explain why he's a great prof, just take one of his courses and witness first hand

I had the best of time in her class; she is caring for her students, and loves what she teaches. I do think she gives out A LOT of readings, but most often from larger books she only picks out chapters and not the whole book. She's flexible with due dates as long as it's reasonable, so I guess it's a fair compromise.
